body.p: Павел прав: Суворов тут участия более не имел, как Томас, а приехал по окончании драк и по поимке злодея. Я надеюсь, что все распри и неудовольствия Павла кончатся, как получит мое приказание ехать к Москве.On 2 October 1774, Pavel Potemkin reported to Catherine that, contrary to Petr Panin's assertions, he had himself played a significantly larger role than Aleksandr Suvorov in the capture of the rebel Emelyan Pugachev (Russkaya starina, 2.10 (October 1870), pp. 409-10). In the same report, Pavel Potemkin asked to be removed from his post as the head of the Secret Commission in Kazan investigating Pugachev; he cited as the main reason for his resignation Petr Panin's refusal to cooperate with him. Their ongoing power struggle echoed that in St. Petersburg between Grigory Potemkin and Nikita Panin. As Catherine mentions in the present letter, she resolved the conflict by transferring Pavel Potemkin to a Special Commission in Moscow that was to prosecute the rebels. (Isabel de Madariaga, Russia in the Age of Catherine the Great, pp. 265-66). Пожалуй, возврати ко мне письмы Петра Ивановича. Ответ нужно сочинить и разрешить некоторые запросы его. А я, миленький, очень тебя люблю и желаю, чтоб пилюли очистили все недуги. Только прошу при них быть воздержан: кушать бульон и пить чай без молока.

Darling, Pavel is right: Suvorov took no more part in it than Thomas did, but rather arrived after the fighting had ended and the villian caught. I hope that all Pavel's contentions and dissatisfactions will end when he receives my order to go to Moscow. Please return to me Petr Ivanovich's letters. An answer must be written and some of his queries resolved. But I, dear one, love you very much and hope that the pills cleared out all your ailments. I only ask that you be restrained while taking them: eat clear soup and drink tea without milk.
